Probably obscure to most people but John Dobson who invented the Dobsonian telescope opening up astronomy to everyone in their backyards. He was born in China, he developed his telescope during his 23 years in a monastery that gave him the ultimatum of ceasing his work or leaving. He left. He was an atheist, had a masters in chemistry. His telescope can be built from scratch or with off the shelf components and is much beloved in the amateur astronomy community.

This is a long and storied history and worth a read for the uninitiated. There have been recent attempts by Democrats to revive it outlined in the Wiki page. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FCC_fairness_doctrine The civility of political discourse took an immediate hit giving rise to the likes of Rush Limbaugh who serves as a perfect example of a hate filled shock jock that regularly spewed conspiracy theories and lies over the radio. An important note that shouldn't be overlooked in the original doctrine below. Imagine if Limbaugh had to do that. gt;Two corollary rules of the doctrine, the personal attack rule and the "political editorial" rule, remained in practice until 2000. The "personal attack" rule applied whenever a person (or small group) was subject to a personal attack during a broadcast. Stations had to notify such persons (or groups) within a week of the attack, send them transcripts of what was said and offer the opportunity to respond on-the-air. The "political editorial" rule applied when a station broadcast editorials endorsing or opposing candidates for public office, and stipulated that the unendorsed candidates be notified and allowed a reasonable opportunity to respond.[34]

WRITING.TEXT: Something else commonly overlooked is under the nails. If your nails are longish, use a nail brush or some other method to scrub them. In a Microbiology class we cultured under our nails and found it harbors all manner of bacteria. I've keep my nails short since as in they don't extend past my fingertips. We also cultured different areas in public bathrooms, if there were handles for water to turn and off, they are by far the most fertile ground for bacteria, followed by the door handle entering/exiting the bathroom and handles of the stalls even more than the toilet handle to flush.

It really is an eye opener. People generally just simply aren't aware. The troublesome part are the increasing numbers of hardened bacteria and other mean nasties to antibiotics and disinfectants. Taking precautions isn't unwarranted or overreacting when there isn't an outbreak of flu. Other ways to protect yourself is to keep any open wounds, even paper cuts covered when in public spaces. Keep your hands away from your mouth, nose and eyes when in public spaces and until you can wash thoroughly. A lot of people will get dried out hands and that in and of itself can be a path when skin begins to breakdown and chap. So once you are home and are clean, moisturize your hands, do this before bed and after bathing. I am a former nurse and my hands really suffered.

UBI isn't broad socialism, it is a pragmatic solution to a vexing issue that is likely to become synergistic in economies.
